subject: Science
title: Enceladus: Geysers in Space
description: A short lesson to help you apply Enceladus: Geysers in Space.

hook.text: Saturn's tiny moon Enceladus is only 500 km wide. But it's full of surprises.

buildup.text: NASA's Cassini spacecraft spotted huge jets of water ice shooting from its south pole.

discovery.text: The geysers come from a global ocean beneath the icy crust.

twist.text: Cassini flew through the plumes and detected organic molecules and hydrogen gas.

climax.text: Hydrogen plus water plus organic molecules â€” that's the recipe for life.

punchline.text: A moon smaller than Arizona might hold life in its hidden sea.

quiz.question: What did Cassini find in Enceladus's geysers?
